item.title: Resources
item.description: Google CTF 2019 Resources Google: Main Page CTF Time: Google CTF 2017 Challenges and Writeups List Google: Github Repo with Solutions Bernie Lim: Beginner’s Quest Jack Halon: Beginner’s Quest CTF Resources CTF Time CBT Nuggets: How to Prepare For a CTF Competition Cybrary: CTF Introduction (useful links at the bottom) Youtube LiveOverflow: What is CTF? Trail of Bits: CTF Field Guide Google: Writeups from previous CTFs Blogs Krebs on Security Cisco Talos Arstechnica Daniel Miessler Phoronix Wired Ycombinator HackerNews Various Learning Challenges Cryptopals: Crypto Implementation Project Euler: Math and logic challenges XSS Games: Cross-site scripting challenges Free Stuff for Students JetBrains software licenses Github Student Developer Pack Azure Student Credit

item.title: How to Edit This Site
item.description: This site is created using the Hugo static site generator. Hugo accepts Markdown and translates it into HTML/CSS/JS based on the provided theme. This site uses the terminal theme. Terminal has some theme-specific features, which are detailed in the previous link. How to build this site: Firstly, make sure that you’re using a recent version of Hugo. The version shipped in Debian stable is too old for our purposes. The author is using v0.
